name: Faded Glory
description: Don't let them put you behind a desk. Time comes for even the most decorated service members, regardless of faction, but there are some who believe the anomalies may help them avoid this eventuality...for better or for worse.
rules:
-- There are two Phases to this Event! Each Phase is individually timed.
-- In this Hybrid Event, you will complete Faction Missions in one phase, and Voyages in another phase.
-- Unique Bajoran, Ferengi Traditionalist, and Klingon Faction Missions are available during the faction phase. Open the Event to access them.
-- In the Voyage Phase, you will engage in Voyages with ocassional Voyage Encounters that will test proficiencies of your voyage crew.
-- Gold and Silver skills for the Voyage Phase will be SEC and CMD. 
-- Voyage Encounters take place at the following points in time: 1 minute, 5 minutes, 15 minutes, 30 minutes, 45 minutes, 1 hour, 1.5 hours, 2 hours, and every 2 hours after that.
-- Passing a Voyage Encounter without losing any contests raises the multiplier for Victory Points gained in contests. Losing a contest resets this multiplier.
-- Three of the following traits are randomly chosen for each Encounter: Inspiring, Explorer, Scoundrel, Casual, Playful, Hero, Marksman, Investigator. Using crew with matching traits increases their Crit Chance in contests.
-- Using any version of Korrd, Ma'ah, Gowron, or Klingons will provide a bonus to antimatter and a permanent multiplier to passively gained Victory Points during the Voyage Phase, as well as bonus to Faction Missions during the Faction Phase.
-- Using the I.K.S. T'Ong, the KDF Targhauler, or the Klingon K'Vort Bird-of-Prey will provide a bonus to antimatter during the Voyage Phase.
-- Using ships with the Freighter trait will provide a bonus to antimatter during the Voyage Phase.
-- In the Voyage Phase you earn Event Victory Points passively by running a voyage, and actively by winning contests during Voyage Encounters. The amount you earn increases with every Voyage Encounter passed. 
-- In the Faction Phase every Faction Mission you complete earns you Event Victory Points. 
-- Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Bonus: Korrd, Ma'ah, Gowron, or Klingons
rewards_teaser: Reach Rank 1 by gaining Victory Points from Event Missions!

featured_crew.name: Seyetik
featured_crew.flavor: A renaissance man, Gideon ultimately sacrificed himself to save his wife.

featured_crew.name: Ma'ah
featured_crew.flavor: Working on the farm, catching targs, delivering blood wine - this is not what Maâ€™ah wants. He dreams of returning to the captain's chair.

featured_crew.name: Gowron
featured_crew.flavor: Gowron, son of M'Rel, was one of the final two challengers to succeed K'Mpec as the Klingon Chancellor.

rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 6 Polestars: Command, Diplomacy, Security, Engineering, Science, Medicine

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.name: Dilithium
rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

rewards.name: Honor
rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.name: Merits
rewards.flavor: Merits can be earned by completing missions. Use Merits to acquire faction-based rewards, upgrades to your ship, and more.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Seyetik
rewards.flavor: A renaissance man, Gideon ultimately sacrificed himself to save his wife.

rewards.name: Gowron
rewards.flavor: Gowron, son of M'Rel, was one of the final two challengers to succeed K'Mpec as the Klingon Chancellor.

rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 5 Polestars: Common, Uncommon, Rare, Super rare, Legendary

screens.text: "Stripped of my rank, robbed of my ship...sent to languish on my family's farm. Is there no end to the humiliation that can be heaped on a warrior?"

"Just wait until you get old, young warrior. Then the ploy is far more insidious. They will leave you your rank, your title, but strip from you the opportunity to die in battle, instead forcing you to languish at diplomatic functions."

"You didn't seem to be languishing to me, Korrd. In fact, you looked rather comfortable. Still, it seems the influx of younger versions of ourselves has only exacerbated the challenges of officers at the end of their careers."

"Perhaps it's time for you to step back. With an endless supply of 'younger versions' of the Empire's greatest warriors, those of you reaping officer's pay will either have to prove your worth or make your peace!"
